item.description: Tightening what kinds of values array columns can hold using constraints and immutable functions

item.description: Using roles for permissions and authorization for users and groups in PG

item.description: Let’s kill a PG connection

item.description: For organizing objects in your DB, or setting up multi-tenancy

item.description: Let’s create a read only group in PG and add users to it

item.description: Pairing up timeseries data when the timestamps don’t match exactly (in Pandas, Polars, DuckDB, Postgres & QuestDB)

item.description: Keeping your database lean

item.title: Graph Query Interfaces: A Comparison Between SQL and Cypher
item.description: Featuring DuckDB & KuzuDB

item.description: Sprinkling some lazy promotion and quick demotion on FIFO

item.title: Notes on 'A large scale analysis of hundreds of in-memory cache clusters at Twitter'
item.description: TTLs are prevalent, object sizes are small, metadata overhead can be large, object sizes change, FIFO is better than LRU, you’ve got to address memory fragmentation

item.title: Some Notes on Vector Indexing in DuckDB
item.description: Once you’ve indexed your vectors for similarity search, be sure to check your query plans, just in case the DB decides to opt for a sequential scan

item.title: Combining Lexical and Semantic Search with Reciprocal Rank Fusion
item.description: Best of both worlds sort of thing

item.title: Vector Indexing and Search with DuckDB & FastEmbed
item.description: Using DuckDB for vector/semantic search

item.title: Leanstore: High Performance Low-Overhead Buffer Pool
item.description: A dash of pointer swizzling, a sprinkle of optimistic locking and a touch of lean eviction, that’s the secret to a high performance buffer pool!

item.title: Tiered Storage via 2-Tree
item.description: Split a data-structure into two: a memory-optimized ’top’-tree and a disk optimized ‘bottom’-tree. Implement a lightweight migration protocol for hot records to move up and cold records down.

item.title: Pointer Swizzling Buffer Pools
item.description: Switching pointers as the data pointed to moves to and fro memory and secondary storage

item.title: Compacting Transactional Data in HyPer
item.description: Keep hot tuples uncompressed, organize cold data into chunks of columns then use lightweight compression, handle both OLTP and OLAP workloads

item.title: Virtual Memory Hot/Cold Data Re-organization for OLTP
item.description: Hot/Cold aware memory allocation with locking of the hot region to physical memory and letting the OS swap out cold LRU pages as needed.

item.title: Offline (but Faster and more Accurate) Classification of Hot and Cold Data
item.description: Hint, it’s based on exponential smoothing

item.title: Anti-Caching
item.description: Track hot/cold data at tuple-level granularity. Evict LRU cold data in blocks.

item.title: Larger-Than-Memory Data Management
item.description: For when the database exceeds the main memory size

item.title: Hybrid Locking & Synchronization
item.description: Fast-path optimistic locking with fallback to pessimistic RW locks under contention

item.title: Optimizing Data Placement for Distributed OLAP Systems
item.description: Using MIP solvers to model and optimize shard placement

item.title: DuckDB JIT Compiled UDFs with Numba
item.description: JIT compiling your vectorized UDFs with Numba. Plus pure SQL is plenty fast if you can figure out how to write it

item.title: Guided Local Search for the Capacitated Facility Location Problem
item.description: Overview of Guided Local Search plus how it can be applied to the capacitated facility location problem.

item.title: Minizinc: Alternative Modeling Approaches for the Facility Location Problem
item.description: Multiple views and Channeling Constraints make for faster models (in some cases)

item.title: The Facility Location Problem
item.description: Discrete Optimization: Where to construct facilities so as to minimize setup costs and customer servicing costs while ensuring each facility is able to meet customer demands.

item.title: Vectorized DuckDB UDFs with Rust and Python FFI
item.description: Implementing vectorized UDFs in Rust that you can use in DuckDB, with a little help from Arrow

item.title: Optimizing CPU & Memory Interaction: Matrix Multiplication
item.description: Same algo, different memory access patterns, what could go wrong (or right)!

item.title: x86 Cache Control Instructions
item.description: Wherein the OS and user get more control over the L1,L2 and L3 caches, mostly for performance.

item.title: Retrieving Memory and Cache Organization
item.description: Memory, Cache levels, Cache sizes, TLB, associativity and so on

item.title: Microbenchmarking: Way more than I set out to know
item.description: RDTSC, Out-of-order execution, OS interrupts, cycles, frequency and more.

item.title: Logging in Go
item.description: Best practices, Logging levels, structured logging, Logging & Telemetry (Metrics, Tracing), Audit logs

item.title: Handling Missing Values in Timeseries Datasets
item.description: Filling gaps using Last observation carried forward, next observation carried backwards, median & linear interpolation

item.title: Wrangling JSON with DuckDB
item.description: For when you need to impose some structure on semi-structured data

item.title: Parquet + Zstd: Smaller faster data formats
item.description: Often, parquet files have to be compressed. For fast compression, use LZ4 or Snappy. For the highest data compression ratio, use brotli. For both, zstd

item.title: Lateral Joins & Iterators in SQL
item.description: Sneaking for-loops into SQL without anyone noticing

item.title: SQL Grouping sets, Rollups & Cube
item.description: Computing multiple Group-bys with less steps

item.title: Programmatically creating a DuckDB table from an Arrow schema
item.description: PyArrow lets you create an empty table. Use that instead of custom mappings to create a DuckDB schema.

item.title: Handling panics from goroutines you've spawned
item.description: It’s one thing to handle a panic that’s occured within a function. It’s an entirely different affair to handle a panic that occured within a goroutine that’s been spawned.

item.title: Benchmarking SQLite inserts
item.description: Going from 750 writes per second to 25,0000 with a bit of configuring

item.title: Getting started with TLA+

item.description: Paper Review

item.title: Distributed Reference Counting
Malloc excess bytes
item.description: Space requested from malloc is a lower bound (at least or more)

item.title: Go data-structure tricks: google/Btree
item.description: A couple of interesting approaches to concurrency and memory allocation from the Go google/btree package

item.title: Generalized Range Difference, Recursion & Search Availability in PostgreSQL
item.description: We’re building a scheduling app. Users mark booked slots, represented in Postgres using time or date-range data types. Let’s see how we can find all the freely available slots efficiently

item.title: Speeding up unique constraint checks in PostgreSQL... or not
item.description: Are exclusion constraints using hash indexes faster than plain old uniqueness checks? Let’s find out

item.title: SQL gotcha: now() vs 'now'
item.description: Make sure you’re using the correct defaults when defining columns

item.title: Bugs From ignoring C Operator Associativity
item.description: Mistakes were made

item.title: Go Channels Suffice for Synchronization
item.description: Or how to implement Futures/Promises in Go without having to juggle locks and waitgroups

item.title: Back To Basics: The foundation of Joins in SQL
item.description: Writing SQL joins without using joins at all. A quick history of Database Models, Schemas, Constraints, Cross-products and everything in between

item.title: SQL joins as reduce/folds over relations
item.description: Of what to make of joins in sql, mental models and building better understanding

item.title: Golang Custom Loggers: using Postgres and Leveldb
item.description: Coupling logging to the some destination (in this case Postgres and leveldb) within the application itself isn’t by any means a good idea. Still, given the flexibility interfaces in Go provide, why not give it a try ¯\(ツ)/¯

item.title: Handling Bank Transactions, V2
item.description: Version 2 of a simplified Node.js-based API + PG database layer for handling a bank’s intra-account transfer operations

item.title: Handling Bank Transactions, V1
item.description: Overview of a simplified Node.js-based API + Postgres database layer for handling a bank’s intra-account transfer operations

item.title: Var, Let, Const and the 'commonly' expected behaviour
item.description: Javascript quirks and idiosyncracies. Or why learning a new programming language is hard when coming in with implicit assumptions from other languages

item.title: PG Transactions & Isolation levels: Airline Seat Booking
item.description: Using the right isolation level to avoid nasty billing errors when building database-managed booking systems

item.title: Logging with trace IDs in Node.js - pino, express and cls-hooked
item.description: A neat way to add tracing or transaction ids for each request-response cycle with as little modification to the rest of the code as possible

item.title: Programming Pearls - Array Rotation
item.description: Programming, Pearls and a couple of interesting solutions for rotating elements within an array
